hints.label: cor-hessian-lipschitz
hints.title: Hessian Lipschitz Continuity
hints.content:
906: :label: cor-hessian-lipschitz
907: 
908: The Hessian $\nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}$ is Lipschitz continuous:
909: 
910: $$
911: \|\nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}(x) - \nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}(y)\| \le K_{V,3}(\rho) \|x - y\|
912: 
913: $$
914: 
915: where $K_{V,3}(\rho) = O(\rho^{-3})$ is the third-derivative bound from C³ regularity (see {prf:ref}`thm-c3-regularity` in [13_geometric_gas_c3_regularity.md](13_geometric_gas_c3_regularity.md)).
hints.raw_directive:
903: ## 9. Stability Implications and Corollaries

906: :label: cor-hessian-lipschitz

908: The Hessian $\nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}$ is Lipschitz continuous:
909: 
910: $$
911: \|\nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}(x) - \nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}(y)\| \le K_{V,3}(\rho) \|x - y\|
912: 
913: $$
914: 
915: where $K_{V,3}(\rho) = O(\rho^{-3})$ is the third-derivative bound from C³ regularity (see {prf:ref}`thm-c3-regularity` in [13_geometric_gas_c3_regularity.md](13_geometric_gas_c3_regularity.md)).

hints.label: proof-cor-hessian-lipschitz
hints.content:
921: :label: proof-cor-hessian-lipschitz
922: 
923: Lipschitz continuity of the Hessian follows from the fundamental theorem of calculus:
924: 
925: $$
926: \nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}(y) - \nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}(x) = \int_0^1 \nabla^3 V_{\text{fit}}(x + t(y-x)) \cdot (y - x) \, dt
927: 
928: $$
929: 
930: Taking norms and using $\|\nabla^3 V_{\text{fit}}\| \le K_{V,3}(\rho)$:
931: 
932: $$
933: \|\nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}(y) - \nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}(x)\| \le K_{V,3}(\rho) \|y - x\|
934: 
935: $$

hints.label: cor-brascamp-lieb
hints.title: Brascamp-Lieb Inequality (Conditional)
hints.content:
947: :label: cor-brascamp-lieb
948: 
949: **Hypothesis:** Assume the fitness potential is uniformly convex: $\nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}(x) \ge \lambda_{\rho} I$ for some $\lambda_{\rho} > 0$ and all $x \in \mathcal{X}$.
950: 
951: **Conclusion:** The QSD $\pi_{\text{QSD}}$ satisfies the Brascamp-Lieb inequality:
952: 
953: $$
954: \text{Var}_{\pi_{\text{QSD}}}[f] \le \int_{\mathcal{X}} \frac{(\nabla f)^2}{\lambda_{\min}(\nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}})} d\pi_{\text{QSD}} \le \frac{1}{\lambda_{\rho}} \|\nabla f\|^2_{L^2(\pi_{\text{QSD}})}
955: 
956: $$
957: 
958: enabling sharp concentration inequalities.

hints.label: prop-bakry-emery-gamma2
hints.title: Bakry-Émery Γ₂ Criterion (Conditional)
hints.content:
985: :label: prop-bakry-emery-gamma2
986: 
987: C⁴ regularity of $V_{\text{fit}}$ ensures the Langevin generator $\mathcal{L} = \Delta - \nabla V_{\text{fit}} \cdot \nabla$ admits a well-defined Γ₂ operator:
988: 
989: $$
990: \Gamma_2(f, f) = \frac{1}{2}\mathcal{L}(\Gamma(f, f)) - \Gamma(f, \mathcal{L} f)
991: 
992: $$
993: 
994: where $\Gamma(f, f) = \|\nabla f\|^2$.
995: 
996: **Curvature hypothesis:** If the fitness potential satisfies the **Bakry-Émery curvature condition**:
997: 
998: $$
999: \Gamma_2(f, f) \ge \lambda_{\text{BE}} \Gamma(f, f) \quad \text{for some } \lambda_{\text{BE}} > 0
1000: 
1001: $$
1002: 
1003: (which is equivalent to $\text{Hess}(V_{\text{fit}}) \ge \lambda_{\text{BE}} I$ for the Langevin generator), then the semigroup $P_t$ is **hypercontractive**:
1004: 
1005: $$
1006: \|P_t f\|_{L^q} \le \|f\|_{L^p} \quad \text{for } q = 1 + (p - 1)e^{2\lambda_{\text{BE}} t}
1007: 
1008: $$
